meanings.definition: Formed into a mass or lumps
meanings.sent1: The clotted cream was perfect for spreading on scones.
meanings.sent2: The milk turned clotted after being left out in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The clotted dough made it challenging to roll out the cookies.
meanings.sent4: The clotted clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton balls.
meanings.sent5: The clotted mixture of paint and glue created a unique texture on the canvas.

meanings.sent1: The clotted blood on the bandage indicated a minor injury.
meanings.sent2: The soup became clotted as it cooled down.
meanings.sent3: The clotted gravy added a rich flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts felt clotted, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The clotted gelatin dessert wiggled on the plate.

meanings.sent1: The clotted fabric had a rough texture against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The wound was clotted with dried blood.
meanings.sent3: The clotted surface of the cake looked unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: The clotted mud on his shoes indicated a walk in the rain.
meanings.sent5: The clotted milkshake was difficult to drink through a straw.
